job_tasks.phrase: Software Testability is responsible to ensure that all features are designed and implemented in a testable way by guiding product teams during the entire lifecycle
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes a crucial aspect of the software development lifecycle, ensuring that software is designed for quality and maintainability, which are core software engineering concerns.

job_tasks.phrase: Non-functional Testing has sufficient knowledge to advocate for the users experience by raising the team's ability to build applications with clear non-functional requirements (eg performance, security, accessibility, usability)
job_tasks.justification: This task focuses on ensuring critical quality attributes of applications, such as performance and security, which are fundamental to robust software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Test Planning & Execution is responsible to plan, execute, and supervise testing of products and features by using techniques such as risk-based testing, exploratory testing, mobbing, pairing, or responsible to identify and investigate issues and ensure they are handled in a sustainable and repeatable way by using continuous improvement techniques
job_tasks.justification: This describes core activities within the software development lifecycle related to ensuring product quality and stability through systematic testing.

job_tasks.phrase: Test Advocacy is responsible to ensure that testing is embedded in the lifecycle of the product by being involved in the planning and design stages of applications and services Is responsible to advocate for testing best practices by explaining why testing is required, and enables others to own testing and quality checks of the product
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the integration of quality assurance practices throughout the product development lifecycle, a key aspect of mature software engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Test Automation has sufficient knowledge to drive and coordinate collaborative improvements of the test automation infrastructure and processes in teams by outlining the pros and cons of automation, where it can be effective, and where it cannot be used. Has sufficient knowledge to increase the overall quality of tests for a product by building automated tests that are isolated, deterministic, valuable and provide fast, reliable feedback.
job_tasks.justification: This involves building and improving automated testing systems and processes, which are essential components of modern software engineering for ensuring efficiency and reliability.

soft_skills.phrase: Critical Thinking: responsible to systematically identify patterns and underlying issues in complex situations, and to find solutions by applying logical and analytical thinking is responsible to constructively evaluate and develop ideas, plans and solutions by reviewing them, objectively taking into account external knowledge, initiating 'SMART' improvements and articulating their rationale

Continuous Quality and Process Improvement: responsible to identify opportunities for process, system and structural improvements (i.e performance gains) by examining and evaluating current process flows, methods and standards
Effective Communication is responsible to deliver clear, well-structured, and meaningful information to a target audience by using suitable communication mediums and language tailored to the audience
Responsible to achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language and practising active listening
Responsible to ask relevant (follow-up) questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on software testing, quality assurance, and process improvement. All identified tasks fall under Macro-Category A: Core Software Engineering as they relate to the development lifecycle and ensuring software quality. Crucially, there is no mention of AI, ML, or Generative AI technologies or tasks. The Software Engineer profile is defined as having exclusively Macro-Category A tasks and not involving AI/ML integration. Therefore, this role aligns with the Software Engineer profile, as it represents a traditional software engineering discipline.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and detailed regarding its responsibilities, which are all related to software testing and quality assurance. The mapping of these tasks to Macro-Category A: Core Software Engineering is reasonable, interpreting the category broadly to include testing as a fundamental software engineering activity. The soft skills are also clearly identifiable. The main challenge is fitting a pure testing role into a coding book specifically designed for GenAI Engineers. While Software Engineer is the closest profile, the book's primary focus is on AI/ML, making the fit imperfect.
